column5: Now that Bass season is here we have been busy boys. We're fishing almost everyday. The sun tan thing is working out pretty good too...HAHAHA Here's some pictures of what you missed in the last ten days if you stayed home to make babies...                     Get off the couch! Garry2R's
ummm... what pics?
Sorry my finger slipped...HAHAHA!

Whoa....how did you know I was sitting on the couch??  Scary!!!  Great stuff Garry...I'd love to be able to fish every day...I'm workin on it though!!!!  My retirement plans include a place on the water and fishing all the time with Bly.
Great report and pics!!!
What did you do with Cory? Did you eat him?LOL  Glad yer having fun Garry.
Must be nice to be able to go out fishing everyday.....  Great job and thanks for sharing Leechman
that picture of you holding that smallmouth came out very unique/nice.
Gotta love those highway 28 bass. Great pics.
Awesome shot of that pike...nice bass pics too....from where I'm sitting [on the couch!]
Cory was responsible for the fancy photography, I just had to hold them...grin.
Good stuff,Garry..I'm jealous!

The one thing I know about Apsley is that I make sure I'm driving the speed limit when I'm 10 miles either side of it---not even 10km over---I've drove that route for 30 plus years and I'm pretty sure they get a new radar gun every year cause the last one wore out.  Bushart
Nice fish Garry.  Maybe I should strap my couch down onto my boat. That sounds like a great idea
Beauty report and love the underwater pic of the piker!!! Thanks.  Cheers, 1leg
Very respectable Bass there Garry.  Beautiful up your way.
Good looking bass!!!
Yer not telling me Cory went bass fishing are ya    No way,he would ever do that.
nope, never...that would be as crazy as fishing for carp.
In the olden days Apsley was the home of the OPP radar school. Those days are gone and so is the radar school.
Was that pike in  Jacks???? Not good news if it was. Been a long time since I was at Jacks but pike in there is bad news for the Muskie population. Congrats on the good time tho!
No, the Pike wasn't in Jack's Lake.
Was it tasty?
I never took it out of the water.  Just grabbed the hook with the pliers and let it shake off at boat side.
